text:
Hi there…I’m wondering if I define a new tag in `JinJava` ….is it possible to have it support single line tag construct and block tags construct?

i.e.
```{% customTag %} ```
```{% customTag %}
{% endcustomTag %}```
Going by the  `Tag` interface it seems it’s one or the other but not both? Also if it’s not supported is there plans to support it as `JinJa`  I think supports both constructs. Many thanks in advance.

As far as I know, such a custom extension isn't supported in Jinja. Closest example would be the set tag with the support for single line and block usage, but the starting tokens look different, which is how it's able to parse correctly. If you find documentation about it, I could look into it more

Is there a way to clone and edit the default search module to allow the search to query a knowledge base? My knowledge base is hosted on knowledge.mydomain...

```                requestUrl = SEARCH_URL + params + "&analytics=true&domain=<http://mydomain.com|mydomain.com>&domain=<http://knowledge.mydomain.com|knowledge.mydomain.com>```
That doesn't appear to be doing it.. Am I missing something?
I think you might also need `&type=KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE`

I have a module that I am appending an additional dict to a list of dicts coming from field data. It was working until recently, maybe the past week or so?
```<!-- module html  -->
{% do module.panels.append({"title":module.tiles_panel.tiles_title,"description":module.tiles_panel.tiles_description,"content_tiles":module.tiles_panel.content_tiles}) %} ```
When I try to upload, I’m now getting the following error:
```[ERROR] internal error
[ERROR] line 5: Cannot find method append with 1 parameters in class com.HubSpot.jinjava.objects.collections.SizeLimitingPyMap```
Any ideas why that’s happening? I noticed JinJava was recently updated, can that have anything to do with it? It’s funny, I can output `module.panels` to the browser as json, copy it, set that value explicitly as a new variable, and appending the object works. But anything i try to do directly with module.panels errors out, even adding `|tojson|fromjson`
